info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 6:21PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...STRONG COLD FRONT ARRIVES SATURDAY MORNING... A strong cold front to surge through Deep South Texas and the Rio Grande Valley Saturday morning with impacts expected through Sunday. Residents of Deep South Texas can expect initial impacts Saturday of very dry air and strong winds combining to increase wildfire danger. The combination of relative humidity between 15-25 percent, winds of 20-30 mph gusts to 45 mph and dry grasses will produce extreme fire behavior in any fires that may ignite. As mentioned, wind gusts to 45 mph are anticipated which may cause some power surges or brief outages with blowing debris, down tree limbs and falling palm fronds as well as other light objects that are not secured or tied down. This front will be come through dry with no rain expected and temperatures will be falling through the morning before leveling off with full sunshine. Daytime Highs will only be in the 50s to lower 60s before dropping quickly after sunset. Saturday night, Sunday morning lows bottom out between 32-35 degrees with exception of portions of the Mid and Lower Rio Grande Valley along and south of Interstate highway 2 from Mission to Harlingen and Brownsville where mid to upper 30s are forecast. Tender and exposed tropical vegetation may be damaged due to cold air. Sunday will see afternoon temperatures recover into the 60s before falling back into the 30s to near 40s Monday morning. The marine areas will also see impacts with this front, Gale warnings are posted for the Laguna Madre and the Gulf waters where winds may gust between 40-45 knots and seas 20-60 nautical miles offshore could exceed 12 feet and could approach 15 feet Sunday morning. Along the immediate coastline, a high surf advisory may be needed with breakers potentially exceeding 6 feet and a coastal flood advisory may be needed for surf reaching the base of the dune Saturday afternoon with high tide occurring at 5:04 PM. To say the least swimming will be dangerous and is discouraged.
